Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The results published here are in whole or part based upon data generated by the Cancer Genome Characterization Initiative (phs000235), [insert project name here (i.e. Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma project], developed by the NCI. The data used for this analysis are available at [fill in with NCBI dbGaP/SRA and/or NCI GDC/DCC url references]. Information about CGCI projects can be found at https://ocg.cancer.gov/programs/cgci.
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Approved users who plan to submit manuscripts using the CGCI: HTMCP & BLGSP data that would be of comparable scope to the initial disease-specific comprehensive analysis publications in each, are expected to abide by publication guidelines as outlined on the project webpage: https://ocg.cancer.gov/programs/cgci/cgci-publications. CGCI dbGaP Accession Numbers: It is possible to reference the dbGaP accession number(s) by substudy within the CGCI parent. Burkitt Lymphoma Genome Sequencing Project (BLGSP): phs000527; HIV+ Tumor Molecular Characterization Project – Cervical Cancer (HTMCP – CC): phs000528; HIV+ Tumor Molecular Characterization Project – Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma (HTMCP – DLBCL): phs000529; HIV+ Tumor Molecular Characterization Project – Lung Cancer (HTMCP – LC): phs000530; Medulloblastoma (MB): phs000531; Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma – Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma (NHL – DLBCL): phs000532; Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma – Follicular Lymphoma (NHL – FL): phs000533. *Note: If data is used from both phs000532 &phs000533, then the reference can be to the larger project (i.e. “Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma (NHL): phs000532/533). CGCI DCC Version Reference: When data stored at the CGCI Data Coordinating Center (e.g. VCF or MAF sequence files pathology results, etc.) are used, Approved Users should reference the version of the CGCI Data Matrix and include “Cancer Genome Characterization Initiative Data Matrix. Retrieve Month Day, Year. Website, https://ocg.cancer.gov/programs/cgci/data-matrix.” Citing CGCI Publications in Manuscripts Using CGCI Data: Additionally, manuscripts using CGCI project datasets should cite each of the first papers published by the appropriate CGCI project or substudy. *Note: As the HTMCP or BLGSP project teams publish their first manuscripts, the reference to be cited will be added. Medulloblastoma (MB; phs000531): Parsons DW, Li M, Zhang X, Jones S, Leary RJ, Lin JC, Boca SM, Carter H, Samayoa J, Bettegowda C, et al. (2011 Jan). The genetic landscape of the childhood cancer medulloblastoma. Science, 331(6016):435-9. Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma (NHL; phs000532/33): Morin RD, Johnson NA, Severson TM, Mungall AJ, An J, Goya R, Paul JE, Boyle M, Woolcock BW, Kuchenbauer F, et al. (2010 Feb). Somatic mutations altering EZH2 (Tyr641) in follicular and diffuse large B-cell lymphomas of germinal-center origin. Nat Genet, 42(2):181-5.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Cancer, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-CA-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Cancer. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

ConsentGroup.title: Pediatric Cancer Research
ConsentGroup.name: PCR
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: These data may be used for research relevant to the biology, causes, treatment and late complications of pediatric cancers. Access to protected medulloblastoma data will be granted solely for those research projects that can only be conducted using pediatric data (i.e., the research objectives cannot be accomplished using data from adults) and that focus on the development of more effective treatments, diagnostic tests, or prognostic markers for childhood cancers. Applications proposing methods, software, or other tool development would not be considered acceptable uses of the data.

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use
ConsentGroup.name: GRU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification.

Medulloblastoma (MB; phs000531): Parsons DW, Li M, Zhang X, Jones S, Leary RJ, Lin JC, Boca SM, Carter H, Samayoa J, Bettegowda C, et al. (2011 Jan). The genetic landscape of the childhood cancer medulloblastoma. Science, 331(6016):435-9. Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma (NHL; phs000532/33): Morin RD, Johnson NA, Severson TM, Mungall AJ, An J, Goya R, Paul JE, Boyle M, Woolcock BW, Kuchenbauer F, et al. (2010 Feb). Somatic mutations altering EZH2 (Tyr641) in follicular and diffuse large B-cell lymphomas of germinal-center origin. Nat Genet, 42(2):181-5.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Cancer, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-CA-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Cancer. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

ConsentGroup.title: Pediatric Cancer Research
ConsentGroup.name: PCR
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: These data may be used for research relevant to the biology, causes, treatment and late complications of pediatric cancers. Access to protected medulloblastoma data will be granted solely for those research projects that can only be conducted using pediatric data (i.e., the research objectives cannot be accomplished using data from adults) and that focus on the development of more effective treatments, diagnostic tests, or prognostic markers for childhood cancers. Applications proposing methods, software, or other tool development would not be considered acceptable uses of the data.

Person.Organization: PROVINCIAL HEALTH SERVICES AUTHORITYBRITISH COLUMBIA CANCER AGENCY

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The results published here are in whole or part based upon data generated by the Cancer Genome Characterization Initiative (phs000235), [insert project name here (i.e. Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma project], developed by the NCI. The data used for this analysis are available at [fill in with NCBI dbGaP/SRA and/or NCI GDC/DCC url references]. Information about CGCI projects can be found at https://ocg.cancer.gov/programs/cgci.
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Approved users who plan to submit manuscripts using the CGCI: HTMCP & BLGSP data that would be of comparable scope to the initial disease-specific comprehensive analysis publications in each, are expected to abide by publication guidelines as outlined on the project webpage: https://ocg.cancer.gov/programs/cgci/cgci-publications. CGCI dbGaP Accession Numbers: It is possible to reference the dbGaP accession number(s) by substudy within the CGCI parent. Burkitt Lymphoma Genome Sequencing Project (BLGSP): phs000527; HIV+ Tumor Molecular Characterization Project – Cervical Cancer (HTMCP – CC): phs000528; HIV+ Tumor Molecular Characterization Project – Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma (HTMCP – DLBCL): phs000529; HIV+ Tumor Molecular Characterization Project – Lung Cancer (HTMCP – LC): phs000530; Medulloblastoma (MB): phs000531; Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma – Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma (NHL – DLBCL): phs000532; Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma – Follicular Lymphoma (NHL – FL): phs000533. *Note: If data is used from both phs000532 &phs000533, then the reference can be to the larger project (i.e. “Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma (NHL): phs000532/533). CGCI DCC Version Reference: When data stored at the CGCI Data Coordinating Center (e.g. VCF or MAF sequence files pathology results, etc.) are used, Approved Users should reference the version of the CGCI Data Matrix and include “Cancer Genome Characterization Initiative Data Matrix. Retrieve Month Day, Year. Website, https://ocg.cancer.gov/programs/cgci/data-matrix.” Citing CGCI Publications in Manuscripts Using CGCI Data: Additionally, manuscripts using CGCI project datasets should cite each of the first papers published by the appropriate CGCI project or substudy. *Note: As the HTMCP or BLGSP project teams publish their first manuscripts, the reference to be cited will be added. Medulloblastoma (MB; phs000531): Parsons DW, Li M, Zhang X, Jones S, Leary RJ, Lin JC, Boca SM, Carter H, Samayoa J, Bettegowda C, et al. (2011 Jan). The genetic landscape of the childhood cancer medulloblastoma. Science, 331(6016):435-9. Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma (NHL; phs000532/33): Morin RD, Johnson NA, Severson TM, Mungall AJ, An J, Goya R, Paul JE, Boyle M, Woolcock BW, Kuchenbauer F, et al. (2010 Feb). Somatic mutations altering EZH2 (Tyr641) in follicular and diffuse large B-cell lymphomas of germinal-center origin. Nat Genet, 42(2):181-5.
